name: Blind Trust
description: Blind Trust is a two-player, cooperative game where the deaf leads the blind on a fantasy island. Navigate using only 3D sound as the blind Oracle, or lead the Oracle with magical sound beacons as the deaf Soldier. Work together to fight monsters, solve puzzles, and reach your ultimate goal.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or later Processor: 1.8 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Not recommended for Intel onboard graphics DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 550 MB available space Sound Card: Required

reviews.review_text: Blind Trust is a game about working with someone you can barely communicate with, making for an amazing expirience. Although the game is short, it makes up for that with incredible gameplay, and a proof of concept that I hope inspires more people to create games that provide this sort of expirience.   If you play this game, I would highly recommend turning off any and all communcation software to make sure you get the most immersion possible. If not, just don't give any hints or commands to the other person that could make the expirience worse. If you're in the same room as the person you're playing with, then don't let any possible frustration with the Oracle show through to the other person. On the (slightly) bad side, there are a few glitches in the game, but they have been addressed by the developers, so if you follow their instruction, nothing should go wrong.  If you just want a short amazing game for you and a friend, download this game. You have nothing to lose, since the game is free, so just play it!

This game didn't last very long. Less than an hour for both play throughs. There are bugs and it crashed a couple of times while playing the game (Mostly during the start of the game.) None of these were really a big deal. One of the bugs was while the beacon is active, The Monster noises would not play. It is a tiny issue (It really didn't slow us down.) but when half the game revolves around sound. It makes it difficult to get immersed.   Despite all that I highly recommend you play this game anyways. The Concept behind it is amazing and despite the few bugs and crashes we experienced. We legitamitly had fun. Especially when we swapped roles.   This game has potential and I hope the developers fix the bugs, and take this a step further.

I tried out blind trust with my good friend and I'd like to say that the game has a really great concept, but is so undeveloped at this stage (June 2016) that it is almost unplayable.   It took us a good five tries to even get into the game after frequent crashes and other errors. Once in the game, we played for a good 10-15 and I have to say I was very entertained even while playing as the blind class (Oracle). Though when we decided to switch roles, we had to exit the entire game, which triggered another crash and when we tried to get back into the same game, it would not work.  So all in all, Im going to give this game a good rating because I truly enjoyed playing it but warn potential players that it needs A LOT of work.

Feels more like a proof of concept or a technical demo more than anything, would be willing to pay for a full game offering a proper story/lore, puzzle gameplay utlising different skills the main characters have and a more detailed combat system.  All in all the game is free and there is no reason not to give it a try with a pal.

Apart from needing LogMeIn Hamachi, this game was unique and a blast to play, however if you are a lonely basement dweller, and have no friends, then you sadly cant play this game. To completely 100% this game (finish the game and get all of the achievements) it takes less than an hour. To finish the game without doing achievements takes 15 minutes. The game didnt have a lot of content, and there is only one main puzzel (the rest of it being killing 3 enemies), but the game was still fun to play never the less. The game has a few bugs, most being at the beggining tutorial, which consist of a bug when you place down the beacon, but the oracle cant move, and another bug at the start happens randomly when you start it up; you basically get a really glitched view of the map for no reason. Other than that, there may rarely be some connection issues, but otherwise the game is fun and quick if you want to play something with a friends. (i recommend attempting to get all of the achievements)  7/10

After scrolling through lists upon lists of free games to play I come across a beautifuly styled and designed game with co-op so I could have fun with friends. Also after discovering the download size was low I urged my friends to get it so we could work together on this partner-based game. Not long after that myself and a friend quickly hopped onto the game.... and couldn't connect. Ah, but we weren't in Hamachi. So we both logged into Hamachi and restarted Blind Trust... Still, couldn't connect. A little research told me that the Evolve Software works, rather than Hamachi, so reluctantly my friend and I both downloaded a software that we didn't have to play a little free game, after 2 long chances. Yet, still, we couldn't connect.  I would like to tell you how fun, amazing and artistic Blind Trust is. But the truth is, I can't, I can't because there is nothing I can play to create evidence of such. The game is purely online co-op so I can't even play offline to even get a taste of it.    I do believe that you can play, but only if you have two computers connected to each other on the same  genuine  network and mimics don't work. But I am not sure.
